page.title: 15Employment in Llangybi
page.content: Llangybi is largely a dormitory area. 75% of household heads travel to work out of the village.Of those employed in the village only 11% now work in agriculture,mostly employed on farms owned by the Llangybi Estate. Service industries are the most important source of employment.A new employer in 1985 is the Cwrt Bleddyn Hotel fully refurbished by its new owner it now provides residential accommodation ,bars,restaurants and function room. Other employers are the public houses, the White Hart,Llangybi and the Royal oak and Greyhound at Llantrisant,all of which have restaurants .The Royal Oak also has 26 units of motel accommodation.A pine furniture business operates from The Greyhound. Each village has a garage with servicing facilities.The Smithy,Post Office Store are familly businesses.
